question: Which of the following rulers of India ceded almost half of his territory to the British as an agreement of Subsidiary Alliance?
explanation: Nawab of Awadh ceded almost half of his territory to the British as an agreement of Subsidiary Alliance. He was forced to sign this treaty in the year 1801. As a result, the Nawab lost the Doab, Rohilkhand, Allahabad. The British enclosed his territory from three sides except for the Himalayan foothills.
